required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Thiol Disulfide Balance in Stage 1 Endometrium Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Thiol Disulfide Balance in Early Stage Endometrium Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate thiol‑disulfide balance in early stage endometrium cancer patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
To date various oxidative stress paramaters were studied in patients with endometrial cancer, however dynamic thiol disulfide hemostasis has not been previously investigated.
The thiol-disulfide balance in the circulation will be measured by the automated system created by Erel & Neselioglu(1).
References
1- Erel O, Neselioglu S. A novel and automated assay for thiol/disulphide homeostasis. Clin Biochem 2014;47:326-32. doi:10.1016/j.clinbiochem.2014.09.026.

primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperative in the morning or preprandial for healthy volunteers
primary_outcome.description: serum native thiol level in μmol/L

intervention.description: Aforementioned oxidative stress markers will be measured via Cobas c501(Roche Diagnostics, Indianapolis, IN, USA) used with sphectrophotometry
Aforementioned oxidative stress markers will be measured via Cobas c501(Roche Diagnostics, Indianapolis, IN, USA) used with sphectrophotometry

biospec_descr.textblock: serum blood samples for aech participant

study_pop.textblock: The preoperative diagnosis of Endometrium cancer was made histopathologically by endometrial biopsy. An experienced pathologist performed frozen section analysis according to the surgical staging scheme of the International Federation of Gynaecology and Obstetrics.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
• Histopathologically confirmed diagnosis of stage I endometrium cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- pulmonary disease
- pulmonary hypertension
- cardiac dysfunction
- renal dysfunction
- liver disease
- chronic ishemia
- systemic inflammation
- concomitant malignancy
- patients who use vitamin A,C or E (antioxidant vitamins)
- patients who use smoke
- patients who use drink alcohol
- patients who use addictive for any drug
